page.title: 14THE MELROSE FESTIVAL
page.content: The most important day of the{Melrose {Festival}is the Saturday.In the morning the{Melrosian}will wake up after a hectic night at the ball to face an exhausting day.He will leave the Market Square in an open car and head for{Thomas The Rhymers Statue}at the{Eildon Tree},where Thomas met the Fairy Queen.Next he rides to{Newstead} where he meets the Masons of Melrose. Then we go to{Trimontion}where the{ {Romans}had their camp.Next over the {Leaderfoot Bridge}to{Gattonside}where the monks had their orchard.Then on to {Abbotsford},the home of{Sir Walter {Scott.}By 11.30am he is heading for{ {Darnick Towers}to recieve a jar of honey from the McDonald family.His final destination is{Melrose Abbey} where a service takes place.He also lays a wreath at the{War Memorial}for the people who died in 2 World Wars.
